Title: Applied Scientist II, Customer Behavior Analytics
Description:
Description

Amazon’s Customer Behavior Analytics org is looking for an Applied Scientist to spearhead the rapid growth of our Marketing Measurement solutions. The team focuses on building scalable ML and causal inference solutions to estimate the effectiveness of Amazon marketing efforts and provide actionable insights to the various marketing teams within Amazon. We work closely with business stakeholders and strive to continuously produce tangible impact on the company’s strategic and tactical planning and operations.

We are looking for a thought leader that has an aptitude for delivering customer-focused solutions and who enjoys working on the intersection of Big-Data analytics, Machine/Deep Learning, and Causal Inference. A successful candidate will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, able to think big and be creative, while still paying careful attention to detail. You should be able to translate how data represents the customer journey, be comfortable dealing with large and complex data sets, and have experience using machine learning and/or econometric modeling to solve business problems. You should have strong analytical and communication skills, be able to work with product managers and software teams to define key business questions and work with the analytics team to solve them. You will join a highly collaborative and diverse working environment that will empower you to shape the future of Amazon marketing, and also allow you to become part of the large science community within the organization.

Key job responsibilities

 Apply expertise in ML and causal modeling to develop new models that describe how Amazon’s marketing campaigns impact customers’ actions Own the end-to-end development of novel scientific models that address the most pressing needs of our business stakeholders and help guide their future actions Improve upon and simplify our existing solutions and frameworks Review and audit modeling processes and results for other scientists, both junior and senior Work with marketing leadership to align our scientific developments with the business strategy Identify new opportunities that are suggested by the data insights Bring a department-wide perspective into decision making Develop and document scientific research to be shared with the greater science community at Amazon and beyond

About The Team

The Customer Behavior Analytics organization owns Amazon’s insights pipeline, from data collection to deep analytics. We aspire to be the place where Amazon teams come for answers, a trusted source for data and insights that empower our systems and business leaders to make better decisions. Our outputs shape Amazon product and marketing teams’ decisions and thus how Amazon customers see, use, and value their experience.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Seattle, WA, USA

Basic Qualifications

 3+ years of building models for business application experience PhD, or Master's degree and 4+ years of CS, CE, ML or related field experience Experience in patents or publications at top-tier peer-reviewed conferences or journals Experience programming in Java, C++, Python or related language Experience building machine learning models or developing algorithms for business application

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience using Unix/Linux Experience in professional software development 2+ years of hands-on predictive modeling and large data analysis experience 2+ years of solving business problems through machine learning, data mining and statistical algorithms experience 2+ years of designing experiments and statistical analysis of results experience

Title: Data Scientist (L5) - Systems Test Enablement
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

Member Product DSE plays a critical role in enabling product innovation across TV, Mobile & Web. Just as we want the Netflix user experience on all of these platforms to be great, we want our partners in Product and Engineering to have a great experience when testing out new features. We aim to make running and analyzing experiments frictionless, efficient, and self-directed while still delivering deep insights.

We strive to make AB testing routine and simple, and we are looking for a Data Scientist who can think about scale and enablement first. You’ll work with engineers, other data scientists, and our Experimentation Platform partners to identify and deliver improvements across the lifecycle of AB tests.


In This Role, You Will


Build connections with stakeholders by embedding in their domain and supporting them with the tools to allow them to design, execute and analyze experiments.Partner with other data scientists on the team, and with the Experimentation Platform organization, to design and build scalable, self-serve experimentation tooling to meet product development needs.Develop experimentation and measurement frameworks to increase the velocity of investments and aid complex decision-making.Advocate for education through great documentation and responsiveness to user needs.Share your work proactively and consistently seek feedback to refine your approach


Visit our Research page to learn about what it’s like to work on Analytics at Netflix.

Experience with supporting AB tests at scale to drive product development.Strong statistical intuition and applied experience solving problems in consumer-facing products. The range for this role is $150,000 - $750,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. Title: Principal Data Scientist
Description:
Do you want to be on the leading edge of using big data to help drive strategy, product and engineering decisions for Microsoft’s largest consumer online service as well as one of most vital commercial services – OneDrive? The OneDrive Data Science team applies our technical analytical skills, working closely with Product, Engineering, User Research, Design, Marketing and Finance to accelerate and maximize the growth one OneDrive’s user and subscriber bases.

We’re looking for a Principal Data Scientist with a proven track record of deeply understanding complex business problems and using industry-leading analytical techniques to find insights that transform our business and customer experiences.

Candidates should be able to take a business or engineering problem from Product or Engineering leaders, translate it to a Data Science problem, conduct the appropriate analysis & modeling to reveal actionable insights, and then communicate those results to the OneDrive Leadership team to drive change.

About Our Culture

We are a modern product and services organization, one of the largest business & consumer services on the planet, and the second biggest workload in Office 365. Data scientists on this team will be part of the broader data science team, and specific product teams focused on tangible and immediate business impact.  We have a tremendous responsibility to our customers to help transform their content needs with Microsoft 365. We use data to organize our business priorities. We empower our industry-leading data science, design, and user research teams to own our product's user experience. We take a direct role in framing our business value directly to our customers and vibrant community of fans. 

Responsibilities

As a Principal Data Scientist, you will be responsible to:

Work cross functionally to translate business problems into ones that can be solved and informed by data analysis.  Have curiosity and apply analytical skills to dive deep into data to find key insights that identify business problems and potential solutions.  Develop models of usage, user behavior & business behavior to make recommendations and influence the product road map.   Work with other teams across Microsoft to develop key metrics to achieve business outcomes.  Be a champion of A/B testing: design, execute and analyze experiments to prove product change attribution.   Utilize tools like SQL, R, Python to execute analyses.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications

Doctorate in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 5+ year(s) data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)OR Master's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 7+ years data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)OR Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 10+ years data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)OR equivalent experience.
Preferred Qualifications

5+ years with leveraging passion for & understand the need to deliver the right business impact by working with stakeholders to turn business problems into data analysis questions and unearthing deep insights from data.   Have a track record of innovative thinking and problem-solving skills using Big Data.  Be self-driven and show the ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete data.  5+ years leveraging the practical uses of statistics (i.e. experimentation, sampling)  Professional experience with large-scale computing systems like Hadoop, MapReduce, and/or similar systems.    5+ years of professional experience in SQL, R, Python, or related tools for large-scale analysis.   Ability to convince other personalities of their ideas and communicate complex analysis & insights to a non-technical audience.

Title: Director, Data Science & Machine Learning
Description:
Angi® is transforming the home services industry, creating an environment for homeowners, service professionals and employees to feel right at “home.” For most home maintenance needs, our platform makes it easier than ever to find a qualified service professional for indoor and outdoor jobs, home renovations (or anything in between!). We are on a mission to become the home for everything home by helping small businesses thrive and providing solutions to financing and booking home jobs with just a few clicks.

Over the last 25 years we have opened our doors to a network of over 200K service professionals and helped over 150 million homeowners love where they live. We believe home is the most important place on earth and are embarking on a journey to redefine how people care for their homes. Angi is an amazing place to build your dream career, join us—we cannot wait to welcome you home!

About The Role

Angi is seeking an exceptional Director of Data Science and Machine Learning to be a driving force behind Angi's transformation. The role is to lead our innovative Matching and Ranking team, tackling challenges such as homeowner-pro matching, search ranking, building dynamic pricing models, and using predictive models to optimize our product and consumer experience. This is a leadership role, developing a team of dedicated machine learning scientists using state-of-the-art machine learning techniques with both structured and unstructured data. In addition to being a leader, we’re also looking for someone who can dive into tech and get their hands dirty to solve some of Angi’s biggest technical challenges.

What You’ll Do

Leadership: Lead and grow a team of talented machine learning & data scientists, providing guidance, mentorship, and support to foster professional growth. For our most complex challenges, you will dive into the tech to work through solutioning alongside your team.Model Development & Data Strategy: Oversee the development and deployment of machine learning models and algorithms to improve our search ranking, pricing our pro product, and how we match consumers with pros. Success in these areas will impact user experience & engagement, retention, and conversion rates - critical metrics for business success.Collaboration with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with a strong team of engineers, product managers, and designers to build scalable and high-impact machine learning systems. Collaborate on the end-to-end development process, from ideation to deployment, ensuring that data-driven solutions are seamlessly integrated into our products and services.Innovation: Foster innovation within the team, exploring new approaches and techniques to solve complex business problems.

Who You Are

You have a Master’s or Ph.D. in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related fields).You have 10+ years of experience in data science & machine learning, with a focus on product personalization, ideally within the tech industry & marketplace environments. You have a proven track record of managing & developing a high-performing data science and machine learning team.You are an expert in machine learning and deep learning, and have a good working knowledge of large language models. You are proficient in SQL and Python. You are not afraid to roll up your sleeves and get in the weeds with your team where needed.You have excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Compensation & Benefits

The salary band for this position ranges from $220,000-$300,000, commensurate with experience and performance. Compensation may vary based on factors such as cost of living. Create Dashboards using AWS QuickSight with both visuals (charts, graphs, etc...) as well as tables for end users to slice and dice data to gain insights to various business processes.Demo work in both small and large virtual settings with clients and end users to obtain feedback on enhancing dashboards to meet business requirements.Work within a SAFe scaled agile framework, collaborating with other data scientists, data engineers, quality engineers, business analyst and product owner to ensure solutions meet client needs with the highest quality.Create and maintain datasets from disparate data sources and provide analysis thereof using SQL and QuickSight.Balance technical data architecture and data flows with end user UX best practices.Ability to tell stories with data, educate effectively, and instill confidence, motivating stakeholders to act on recommendations.Engage with Data Engineering to build out next-level data infrastructure (DBT).Participate in code reviews in GitHub and knowledge sharing, specifically when building solutions within a specific business domain that other team members may not work in.Partner with customers, product owner, business analyst on gathering requirements or doing mockups of what a potential dashboard solution might look like.Collaborate with data scientists and data engineers in the team and across the company.

Minimum Qualifications

5 years’ excellent problem-solving skills and end-to-end quantitative thinking.5 years’ experience in data & analytics projects using data applications to develop insights from large datasets; and handling large datasets.2 years’ experience working with tools like JIRA, GitHub, and Confluence.2 years’ experience with working on cloud platforms in AWS.2 years’ strong understanding of relational database and data warehousing concepts (e.g. OLAP, dimensional modeling.2 years’ experience with one or more statistical software and database management software packages (e.g. R, Python, and SAS).2 years’ experience with one or more analytical and visualization software packages (such as QuickSight, PowerBI, Tableau and GIS software).

Preferred Experience

Experience with data linking / advanced data management, combining data from different sources, automation, and deploying data science solutions at scale.Experience in data organization, cleaning, treating, etc., a knowledge of version control and reproducibility.

Professional Skills
